    RecordSource ="SELECT SpecialWinners.RXN, SpecialWinners.ENTRY_DATE, SpecialWinners.Desc_FN, Sp"
        "ecialWinners.Desc_LN, SpecialWinners.SCH_CODE, Schools.SCHOOL, SpecialWinners.NC"
        "AT, SpecialWinners.EXHB_TITLE, SpecialWinners.PID, Persons.FNAME, Persons.MI, Pe"
        "rsons.LNAME, Persons.SALUTATION FROM (SpecialWinners LEFT JOIN Persons ON Specia"
        "lWinners.PID=Persons.PID) LEFT JOIN Schools ON SpecialWinners.SCH_CODE=Schools.S"
        "CH_CODE ORDER BY SpecialWinners.RXN; "

                    Name ="Combo6"
                    ControlSource ="SCH_CODE"
                    RowSourceType ="Table/Query"
                    RowSource ="SELECT Schools.SCH_CODE, IIf(IsNull([SCHOOL]),IIf(SCH_CODE>996,\" \" & [SCH_CODE"
                        "] & [Addr],\" Blank Name # \" & [SCH_CODE]),[SCHOOL]) AS Sch FROM Schools ORDER "
                        "BY IIf(IsNull([SCHOOL]),\" Blank Name # \" & [SCH_CODE],[SCHOOL]); "
                    ColumnWidths ="0;1710"
                    BaseInfo ="\"SELECT Schools.SCH_CODE, IIf(IsNull([SCHOOL]),IIf(SCH_CODE>996,\"\" \"\" & [SC"
                        "H_CODE] & [Addr],\"\" Blank Name # \"\" & [SCH_CODE]),[SCHOOL]) AS Sch FROM Scho"
                        "ols ORDER BY IIf(IsNull([SCHOOL]),\"\" Blank Name # \"\" & [SCH_CODE],[SCHOOL]);"
                        " \";\"Schools\";\"\";\"SCH_CODE\";\"IIf(IsNull([SCHOOL]),IIf(SCH_CODE>996,\"\" \""
                        "\" & [SCH_CODE] & [Addr],\";\"PrimaryKey\""

                Begin Label
                    OverlapFlags =247
                    Left =9060
                    Top =1260
                    Width =540
                    Height =210
                    Name ="Label80"
                    Caption ="Delete"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0xe436953ca62d1d4badffde018dcd5eed
                    End
                End
                Begin Line
                    OverlapFlags =127
                    Left =1680
                    Top =1380
                    Width =300
                    Name ="Line81"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0x8df6b46da9838e49bfc10e8d9e13cdeb
                    End
                    LeftPadding =30
                    TopPadding =30
                    RightPadding =30
                    BottomPadding =30
                    GridlineStyleLeft =0
                    GridlineStyleTop =0
                    GridlineStyleRight =0
                    GridlineStyleBottom =0
                    GridlineWidthLeft =1
                    GridlineWidthTop =1
                    GridlineWidthRight =1
                    GridlineWidthBottom =1
                End
                Begin Line
                    OverlapFlags =119
                    Left =1980
                    Top =1380
                    Width =0

                    GUID = Begin
                        0x62950702a31330478a367538cb268885
                    End

                    RightPadding =30
                    BottomPadding =30

                    GridlineStyleTop =0
                    GridlineStyleRight =0
                    GridlineStyleBottom =0

                    GridlineWidthBottom =1

                    GridlineStyleBottom =0

                    GridlineWidthBottom =1
                End

                    OverlapFlags =119
                    Left =2280

                    BottomPadding =30

                    GridlineStyleRight =0

                    GridlineWidthBottom =1
                End
                Begin ComboBox
                    TabStop = NotDefault
                    OverlapFlags =85

                    Width =720

                        Begin Label
                            OverlapFlags =85

                    OverlapFlags =247

End
CodeBehindForm
Attribute VB_GlobalNameSpace = False
Attribute VB_Creatable = True
Attribute VB_PredeclaredId = True
Attribute VB_Exposed = False
'    SciFairMaster.mdb  (All class objects and modules)
'
'    Copyright (C) 2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013,
'                  2014  Dennis e.Spanogle
'
'    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
'    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
'    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
'    (at your option) any later version.
'
'    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
'    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
'    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
'    GNU General Public License for more details.
'
'    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
'    along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
Option Compare Database
Option Explicit
Private msg As String
Private Title As String
Private HoldCRCState As Boolean ' current state of 'Confirm Record Change' option
Private DidDelete As Boolean
Private DidAdd As Boolean
Private InAdd As Boolean
Private DidPersonAdd As Boolean
Dim NewPID As Long
Private ctlPrevFocus As Control
Private DeleteLast As Boolean
Private tRXN As Long   ' hold for delete logs
Private tLNAME As String
Private tFNAME As String
Private DeletePID As Long
Private criteria As String
Private personsRS As Recordset
Private Sub Form_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
   ' added rev 5.4.0
   If RXN > 94 Then
     If MsgBox("Entries 95,96,97,98,99 and 100 are application use only!" & vbCrLf & _
            "They should not be Edited! Continue Anyway?" & vbCrLf & vbCrLf & _
            "Click NO, then OK, Then press the Esc key on the keyboard. (Recommended)" & vbCrLf & _
            "Click Yes only if you have read and understand the instructions!", _
            vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, "Edit Not Recomended!") = vbNo Then
            
            
        Cancel = True
        Exit Sub
      End If
   End If
  If IsNull(Me.SCH_CODE) Then
    MsgBox "Select an Existing School" & vbCrLf & _
          "To Show BLANK on Script, Select a School" & vbCrLf & _
          "With a Blank Name (i.e. School 997,998,999)", , Title
    Cancel = True
  End If
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Close()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", HoldCRCState
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub RXN_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  'You may not want users to change the key value!
  ' Use this area to warn of changes
  '  Warn if about to change
  If Not IsNull(Me.RXN) And InAdd = False _
          Then 'And TouchedUndo = False _ ' Replace /Edit This
    msg = "You are about to change the Key Value RXN!" & vbCrLf & _
          "Although OK, Be sure you want to do this!" & vbCrLf & _
          " (Hint: Press [Esc] key after selecting [NO]) " & vbCrLf & _
          "CHANGE RXN? "
    If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
       Cancel = True
       Exit Sub
    End If
  End If
  If Me.RXN > 100 Or Me.RXN < 1 Then
    msg = "RXN must be between 1 and 100! "
    MsgBox msg, vbOKOnly, Title
    Cancel = True
    Exit Sub
  End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub RXN_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  If DeleteLast = False Then
   If DidAdd = True Then
    'Note: In general it is best to do these in Form.After Update or...
    ' if do it here it messes up the abort proceedure if focus is on this
    ' text box because trying to abort causes an exit that creates data and
    ' does not allow the abort.. if me.rxn is null then probably aborting
    If IsNull(Me.ENTRY_DATE) And IsNull(Me.RXN) = False Then
       Me.ENTRY_DATE = Format(Now, "mm/dd/yy")
    End If
    Me.cbRXN.Requery
    Me.lblRXN.Caption = "Becomes SFEM EXN (1 to 100)"
   End If
  End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindName_AfterUpdate()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If IsNull(Me.cbFindName) Then Exit Sub
   ' Find the record that matches the control.
   Me.Recordset.FindFirst "[RXN] = " & Str(Me![cbFindName])
   'Dim rs As Object
   'Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
   'rs.FindFirst "[JUN] = " & str(Me![cbFindName])
   'Me.Bookmark = rs.Bookmark
   Me.cbFindName = Null
   Me.RXN.SetFocus
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindName_Enter()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If DidDelete = True Then
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     Me.cbRXN.Requery
     DidDelete = False
   End If
   If DidAdd = True Then
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     Me.cbRXN.Requery
     DidAdd = False
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbRXN_AfterUpdate()
    Dim rs As Object
    Dim xval As Integer
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If (IsNull(Me.cbRXN)) Then
       'MsgBox "No RXN Selected"
       'cbRXN.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
    End If
    xval = Me![cbRXN]
    Me.Recordset.FindFirst "[RXN] = " & Format(xval) & " "
    'Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
    'rs.FindFirst "[RXN] = " & Format(xval) & " "
    'Me.Bookmark = rs.Bookmark
    Me.cbRXN = Null
    Me.RXN.SetFocus
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbRXN_Enter()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If DidDelete = True Then
     Me.cbRXN.Requery
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     DidDelete = False
   End If
   If DidAdd = True Then
     Me.cbRXN.Requery
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     DidAdd = False
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Delete(Cancel As Integer)
   ' This plus Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm work to ALWAYS show a delete message
   ' Even if user has turned off the warning messages.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If RXN > 94 Then
     MsgBox "Entries 95,96,97,98,99 and 100 are required for application use" & vbCrLf & _
            "They must not be deleted!   Action canceled!"
     Cancel = True
     Exit Sub
   End If
   msg = "DELETE RECORD?"
   If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
      Cancel = True
      Exit Sub
   End If
   DidDelete = True   ' Indicate did a delete of the special winner
   ' Can Not Delete the person yet because the SpecWin Still Exists.
   ' This is due to Enforce Referential Integrity being set.
   ' So save the PID (person_ of the judge being deleted  so can ask later
   ' IMPORTANT:   IF we were in a new record (Even though me.NewRecord = False)
   ' Access now SETS NewRecord True and Form.Current is CALLED. This happens
   ' Before the Form_AfterDelete Confirm.  In Fact in some cases My Code in
   ' Form_Current can cause AfterDelConfirm to NOT BE CALLED.  This is true
   ' If the code in Form_Current sets any fields true (which then sets any
   ' autonumbers (like TID, STID...depending on which form and query)
   ' BEST to NOT SET FIELDS IN Form_Current
   DeletePID = IIf(IsNull(Me.PID), 0, Me.PID)
   tRXN = Me.RXN
   tLNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me.LNAME), "", Me.LNAME)
   tFNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me.FNAME), "", Me.FNAME)
   DidDelete = True   ' Indicate did a delete of the judge
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm(Cancel As Integer, Response As Integer)
   ' This suppresses the system confirmation message, I give message in
   ' Sub Form_Delete (
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Response = acDataErrContinue
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_AfterDelConfirm(STATUS As Integer)
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Call ScifairLog("Del SpecWinner RXN: ", tRXN, " " & tLNAME & ", " & tFNAME)
  ' Delete the person record?
   If DeletePID <> 0 Then '  judge delted,  see if want to delete Person
     criteria = "SELECT * FROM Persons"
     Set personsRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
     With personsRS
       .FindFirst "PID = " & DeletePID
       If .NoMatch Then
         ' do nothing, not even there?
       Else  ' Ask if want to delete person
          Dim Name As String
          Name = IIf(IsNull(!LNAME), "", !LNAME) & ", " & _
          IIf(IsNull(!FNAME), "", !FNAME) & " " & _
          IIf(IsNull(!MI), "", !MI) & " " & _
          IIf(IsNull(!SALUTATION), "", !SALUTATION) & "  (" & _
          IIf(IsNull(!TP), "", !TP) & ")"
          If MsgBox(Name & vbCrLf & "Delete PERSON?", _
                     vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbYes Then
            .Delete
            Call ScifairLog(" Del Person PID: ", DeletePID, " " & Name)
          End If
       End If
       .Close
     End With
     DeletePID = 0
   End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Current()
  On Error GoTo SubError
  If Me.NewRecord Then
     DidAdd = True
     InAdd = True
     Me.tbRecord = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.tbNumRec = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Dim rxnum As Integer
     Dim ii As Integer
     Me.cbRXN.Requery
     If DeleteLast = False Then ' skip if went to add due to delete last
      For rxnum = 1 To 100
       For ii = 0 To Me.cbRXN.ListCount - 1  ' check all number in query
         If Val(Me.cbRXN.Column(0, ii)) = rxnum Then
           Exit For ' RSN used, so do nothing
         End If
       Next ii
       If ii = Me.cbRXN.ListCount Then 'this is true if did not find RXN
         ' did not find, can use this RXN
         Me.RXN = rxnum ' ----- Fill in the RXN field --------------------
         Me.lblRXN.Caption = " <--- First Available RXN "
         Exit For
       End If
      Next rxnum
      If rxnum = 101 Then  ' This may occur
       msg = "No available RXN Numbers 1 to 100" & vbCrLf & _
            "You Must Delete a Record!"
       MsgBox msg, vbOKOnly, Title
      End If
     End If  ' if delete last = false
  Else
     DeleteLast = False
     InAdd = False
     Me.lblRXN.Caption = "Becomes SFEM EXN (1 to 100)"
     Me.tbNumRec = Me.Recordset.RecordCount
     Me.tbRecord = Me.CurrentRecord
  End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Load()
  ' The next statements give a type mismatch error unless or until
  ' I fixed the priority of references in the Visual Basic Tools option.
  ' Sequence must be:
  ' Visual Basic for Applications
  ' Microsoft Access 9.0 Library
  ' Microsoft Office 9.0 Library
  ' OLE Automation
  ' Microsoft DAO 3.6 Obj Lib
  ' Microsoft Visual Basic of Application Extensibility 5.3
  '  Others as needed
  On Error GoTo SubError
  HoldCRCState = Me.Application.GetOption("Confirm Record Changes")
  Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", True
  Title = "SpecialWinners Edit"
  DidDelete = False
  DidAdd = False
  Me.Rev.Caption = RevisionDate
  Me.lblRXN.Caption = "Becomes SFEM EXN (1 to 100)"
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnFirst_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acFirst
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnFirst_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnFirst_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnFirst_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnPrev_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnPrev_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnPrev_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnPrev_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnNext_Click
    If Me.CurrentRecord = Me.Recordset.RecordCount Then
       MsgBox "End of Data!"
       ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
    End If
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNext
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnNext_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnNext_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnNext_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnLast_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acLast
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnLast_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnLast_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnLast_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnAdd_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnAdd_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNewRec
    Me.RXN.SetFocus
Exit_btnAdd_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnAdd_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnAdd_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnDelete_Click
      DeleteLast = False
      If Me.Recordset.RecordCount = Me.CurrentRecord Then  'last record
        DeleteLast = True
      End If
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 8, , acMenuVer70  'Select Record
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 6, , acMenuVer70  'Delete
      If DeleteLast = True Then ' Stupid Bill Gates went to add new record - dumbshit
        'On Error Resume Next '
        'DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, acUndo, , acMenuVer70
        'On Error GoTo Err_btnDelete_Click
        DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
        DeleteLast = False
      End If
      On Error Resume Next ' Skip all messages re not able to focus
      ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnDelete_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnDelete_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnDelete_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_Click()
    Dim svRXN As Long
    On Error GoTo Err_btnSave_Click
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, acSaveRecord, , acMenuVer70
    svRXN = Me.RXN
    ' The next command does a Remove Filter Sort which in effect requeries
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, 3, , acMenuVer70 'RemFiltSort
    Me.Recordset.FindFirst "RXN = " & svRXN
    Dim test As Long
    test = Me.RXN
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnSave_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnSave_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnSave_Click
End Sub
